84 static int32_t CLI_help (int32_t argc, char* argv[])
85 {
86  uint32_t index;
87 
88  /* Display the banner: */
89  CLI_write ("Help: This will display the usage of the CLI commands\n");
90  CLI_write ("Command: Help Description\n");
91 
92  /* Cycle through all the registered CLI commands: */
93  for (index = 0; index < gCLI.numCLICommands; index++)
94  {
95  /* Display the help string*/
96  CLI_write ("%s: %s\n",
97  gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[index].cmd,
98  (gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[index].helpString == NULL) ?
99  "No help available" :
100  gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[index].helpString);
101  }
102 
103  /* Is the mmWave Extension enabled? */
104  if (gCLI.cfg.enableMMWaveExtension == 1U)
105  {
106  /* YES: Pass the control to the extension help handler. */
107  CLI_MMWaveExtensionHelp ();
108  }
109  return 0;
110 }
111 
122 static void CLI_task(UArg arg0, UArg arg1)
123 {
124  uint8_t cmdString[256];
125  char* tokenizedArgs[CLI_MAX_ARGS];
126  char* ptrCLICommand;
127  char delimitter[] = " \r\n";
128  uint32_t argIndex;
129  CLI_CmdTableEntry* ptrCLICommandEntry;
130  int32_t cliStatus;
131  uint32_t index;
132 
133  /* Do we have a banner to be displayed? */
134  if (gCLI.cfg.cliBanner != NULL)
135  {
136  /* YES: Display the banner */
137  CLI_write (gCLI.cfg.cliBanner);
138  }
139 
140  /* Loop around forever: */
141  while (1)
142  {
143  /* Demo Prompt: */
144  CLI_write (gCLI.cfg.cliPrompt);
145 
146  /* Reset the command string: */
147  memset ((void *)&cmdString[0], 0, sizeof(cmdString));
148 
149  /* Read the command message from the UART: */
150  UART_read (gCLI.cfg.cliUartHandle, &cmdString[0], (sizeof(cmdString) - 1));
151 
152  /* Reset all the tokenized arguments: */
153  memset ((void *)&tokenizedArgs, 0, sizeof(tokenizedArgs));
154  argIndex = 0;
155  ptrCLICommand = (char*)&cmdString[0];
156 
157  /* comment lines found - ignore the whole line*/
158  if (cmdString[0]=='%') {
159  CLI_write ("Skipped\n");
160  continue;
161  }
162 
163  /* Set the CLI status: */
164  cliStatus = -1;
165 
166  /* The command has been entered we now tokenize the command message */
167  while (1)
168  {
169  /* Tokenize the arguments: */
170  tokenizedArgs[argIndex] = strtok(ptrCLICommand, delimitter);
171  if (tokenizedArgs[argIndex] == NULL)
172  break;
173 
174  /* Increment the argument index: */
175  argIndex++;
176  if (argIndex >= CLI_MAX_ARGS)
177  break;
178 
179  /* Reset the command string */
180  ptrCLICommand = NULL;
181  }
182 
183  /* Were we able to tokenize the CLI command? */
184  if (argIndex == 0)
185  continue;
186 
187  /* Cycle through all the registered CLI commands: */
188  for (index = 0; index < gCLI.numCLICommands; index++)
189  {
190  ptrCLICommandEntry = &gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[index];
191 
192  /* Do we have a match? */
193  if (strcmp(ptrCLICommandEntry->cmd, tokenizedArgs[0]) == 0)
194  {
195  /* YES: Pass this to the CLI registered function */
196  cliStatus = ptrCLICommandEntry->cmdHandlerFxn (argIndex, tokenizedArgs);
197  if (cliStatus == 0)
198  {
199  CLI_write ("Done\n");
200  }
201  else
202  {
203  CLI_write ("Error %d\n", cliStatus);
204  }
205  break;
206  }
207  }
208 
209  /* Did we get a matching CLI command? */
210  if (index == gCLI.numCLICommands)
211  {
212  /* NO matching command found. Is the mmWave extension enabled? */
213  if (gCLI.cfg.enableMMWaveExtension == 1U)
214  {
215  /* Yes: Pass this to the mmWave extension handler */
216  cliStatus = CLI_MMWaveExtensionHandler (argIndex, tokenizedArgs);
217  }
218 
219  /* Was the CLI command found? */
220  if (cliStatus == -1)
221  {
222  /* No: The command was still not found */
223  CLI_write ("'%s' is not recognized as a CLI command\n", tokenizedArgs[0]);
224  }
225  }
226  }
227 }
228 
242 void CLI_write (const char* format, ...)
243 {
244  va_list arg;
245  char logMessage[256];
246  int32_t sizeMessage;
247 
248  /* Format the message: */
249  va_start (arg, format);
250  sizeMessage = vsnprintf (&logMessage[0], sizeof(logMessage), format, arg);
251  va_end (arg);
252 
253  /* Log the message on the UART CLI console: */
254  if (gCLI.cfg.usePolledMode == true)
255  {
256  /* Polled mode: */
257  UART_writePolling (gCLI.cfg.cliUartHandle, (uint8_t*)&logMessage[0], sizeMessage);
258  }
259  else
260  {
261  /* Blocking Mode: */
262  UART_write (gCLI.cfg.cliUartHandle, (uint8_t*)&logMessage[0], sizeMessage);
263  }
264 }
265 
281 int32_t CLI_open (CLI_Cfg* ptrCLICfg)
282 {
283  Task_Params taskParams;
284  uint32_t index;
285 
286  /* Sanity Check: Validate the arguments */
287  if (ptrCLICfg == NULL)
288  return -1;
289 
290  /* Initialize the CLI MCB: */
291  memset ((void*)&gCLI, 0, sizeof(CLI_MCB));
292 
293  /* Copy over the configuration: */
294  memcpy ((void *)&gCLI.cfg, (void *)ptrCLICfg, sizeof(CLI_Cfg));
295 
296  /* Cycle through and determine the number of supported CLI commands: */
297  for (index = 0; index < CLI_MAX_CMD; index++)
298  {
299  /* Do we have a valid entry? */
300  if (gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[index].cmd == NULL)
301  {
302  /* NO: This is the last entry */
303  break;
304  }
305  else
306  {
307  /* YES: Increment the number of CLI commands */
308  gCLI.numCLICommands = gCLI.numCLICommands + 1;
309  }
310  }
311 
312  /* Is the mmWave Extension enabled? */
313  if (gCLI.cfg.enableMMWaveExtension == 1U)
314  {
315  /* YES: Initialize the CLI Extension: */
316  if (CLI_MMWaveExtensionInit (ptrCLICfg) < 0)
317  return -1;
318  }
319 
320  /* Do we have a CLI Prompt specified? */
321  if (gCLI.cfg.cliPrompt == NULL)
322  gCLI.cfg.cliPrompt = "CLI:/>";
323 
324  /* The CLI provides a help command by default:
325  * - Since we are adding this at the end of the table; a user of this module can also
326  * override this to provide its own implementation. */
327  gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[gCLI.numCLICommands].cmd = "help";
328  gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[gCLI.numCLICommands].helpString = NULL;
329  gCLI.cfg.tableEntry[gCLI.numCLICommands].cmdHandlerFxn = CLI_help;
330 
331  /* Increment the number of CLI commands: */
332  gCLI.numCLICommands++;
333 
334  /* Initialize the task parameters and launch the CLI Task: */
335  Task_Params_init(&taskParams);
336  taskParams.priority = gCLI.cfg.taskPriority;
337  taskParams.stackSize = 4*1024;
338  gCLI.cliTaskHandle = Task_create(CLI_task, &taskParams, NULL);
339  return 0;
340 }
341 
354 int32_t CLI_close (void)
355 {
356  /* Shutdown the CLI Task */
357  Task_delete(&gCLI.cliTaskHandle);
358 
359  /* Cleanup the memory */
360  memset ((void*)&gCLI, 0, sizeof(CLI_MCB));
361  return 0;
362 }
